Posts.Content: Hi again, I'm going to moan again I'm afraid. 11days after my first T and I've never felt so bad. My hands and feet r unbearable,I've got an upset tum, I'm tired all the time and was in a&e last Friday with a temp of 38.8. Not neutropenic tho. I've got to visit the unit tomorrow as they are worried because my arms are now getting red, and there was something in my bloods.. At this rate I won't be going away on Saturday. Did anyone else have sore feet etc, and how long did it last.. Unless they can find some way to stop it next time I might just give up. Oh and all my joints hurt. There I've finished now. Kath. Xx
Posts.Title: Planter palm etc.

Posts.Content: Hi all. Just wanted to let you know that my gorgeous granddaughter had the operation on her skull yesterday and is doing fine. She will have to have more operations as she goes on growing, but that's the third one out of the way. She will have discomfort and swelling for some time but is doing OK. I've mentioned her and her Aperts several times on here so just thought I'd let you know. She is only two but is coping so well and we are all very proud of her. Kath
Posts.Title: Granddaughter's op

Posts.Content: I'm taking anastrozole, have been for 12 weeks and am now getting the side effects kick in. Aching joints. Tiredness. No energy, but it's better than getting the cancer back!! Hopefully it will do its job. Kath.
Posts.Title: Letrozole are dreadful

Posts.Content: I looked up the M&S bras but they are too small for me I gather. I'm a 22 and there's a review saying they are tight on an 18. Some of the other sports bras come in larger, but dearer so may have to try them. Don't want under wired tho. Live in charmouth in Dorset so hard to get to try on. Xx
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I looked up the M&S bras but they are too small for me I gather. I'm a 22 and there's a review saying they are tight on an 18. Some of the other sports bras come in larger, but dearer so may have to try them. Don't want under wired tho. Live in charmouth in Dorset so hard to get to try on. Xx
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks all, will try all suggestions. Evans have some bras that might do for during radiotherapy.
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi all, I had two lumpectomies on my left breast, very close together, only one incision area. Second op was Xmas Eve. All now settling down, and I'm beginning to think about my looks again. Don't want any more surgery, but would like something to balance out my boobs for special occasions etc. who do I see about this as not been offered anything. There is quite a difference in size, and I've been wearing layered clothes, not so good for summer! Kath
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I'll try my breast care nurse then, and get some M&S bras for during radiotherapy. I am quite large, well on one side so hope they will be supportive enough. Thanks for all advice. Kath
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks all, will try all suggestions. Evans have some bras that might do for during radiotherapy.
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi all, I had two lumpectomies on my left breast, very close together, only one incision area. Second op was Xmas Eve. All now settling down, and I'm beginning to think about my looks again. Don't want any more surgery, but would like something to balance out my boobs for special occasions etc. who do I see about this as not been offered anything. There is quite a difference in size, and I've been wearing layered clothes, not so good for summer! Kath
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I'll try my breast care nurse then, and get some M&S bras for during radiotherapy. I am quite large, well on one side so hope they will be supportive enough. Thanks for all advice. Kath
Posts.Title: Prosthesis after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I had my first chemo on Thursday and have had a continual headache since. Drinking well so not dehydration. Very nauseous despite meds,but not vomiting. Have spent all my time in bed till now, can't read or watch tv. This is taking all my effort. Kath
Posts.Title: Headache afterFEC

Posts.Content: I have emend, so lord knows how I'd be without it, and metroclopramide , and had some ondansetrol initially. Definitely not constipated though!! Didn't use ice pack as I get migraines anyway so didn't want to risk it. Kaff
Posts.Title: Headache afterFEC

Posts.Content: Hi all, thanks for your replies, it does feel like a step towards being me again, albeit a different me. My hair is very slowly growing back, white. Not unexpected as it was mostly white anyway, apparently red heads go white not grey. Only trouble is because it's white it doesn't show so I still look bald. Can't wait till I can colour it. Don't know what colour the rest is yet! Kath
Posts.Title: Duh. Chemo brain still active.

Posts.Content: Hi. Had to share this with you fellow travellers on this rocky road. I finished my chemo about six weeks ago, and am now 1/3 of the way through radiotherapy. For a couple of days I've been a bit itchy down below and was thinking of mentioning it to someone. Just now in the shower I realised why! My body hair is growing back!!! Had a close look and so are my eyebrows and eyelashes. Laughing at myself, but also tearing up as well. Not sure why, guess it's a feeling of normality. Kath xxx
Posts.Title: Duh. Chemo brain still active.

Posts.Content: I've been awake now for twenty two hours, and I can't sleep. I'm shattered afterTax yesterday but I can't sleep. Any ideas.
Posts.Title: Can't sleep.

Posts.Content: Thanks for advice. I finally managed to get some sleep about 7 a.m. I think part of the problem was that I had to have my pre T steroids intravenously as they forgot to give me the tablets to take the day before! I've stopped taking them now as I am not feeling sick and the nurses said I could as they give me awful headaches as well. Worse than feeling queasy! I'll still have to take the ones the day before my next treatment as they are to protect against a bad reaction apparently. I play candy crush lots, just wish there'd give more lives. Lol. K
Posts.Title: Can't sleep.

Posts.Content: I look through lots of posts, and get very confused by the differences in treatments. I had two lumps removed. In two ops and lymph nodes stripped after sentinel nodes found three affected. All others were clear tho. So why do some have mx and others lumpectomies for what seem similar size etc. worries me that I may not have had enough done. Also now I'm on chemo and seems like some people get more meds to go with chemo than others. E.g. I having injections growth hormones to increase white cell count I think but not everyone gets them. Also I had to have steroids before Tax as risk of bad reaction but a friend doesn't. Very confusing and I don't get it. It's stressed enough without worrying that my treatment is different. I understand that second lump was found as my cancer turned out to be not what initial biopsy result showed so had an MRI scan which found lymph node right next to original lump with cancer signs but can't help thinking I should have had mx at this point. Rather muddled post. Sorry. Had first Tax yesterday. Very tired but can't sleep probably steroids which I had to have intravenously as they forgot to give me tablets! Kath
Posts.Title: Difference in treatments. Why so much! Confused.

Posts.Content: I have had hip pain for years, but because it's got worse I have to have a scan as well. It's worrying me a bit as well. I've yet to have my radiotherapy and they won't do it till after that. Strangely, I've had to delay my rads by a week as my lovely granddaughter has to have an operation on her head at the beginning of June. I hope your grandson is ok. If you want to chat about that or other stuff you are welcome to pm me. Kath.
Posts.Title: Bone Scan

Posts.Content: Personal message, it means can chat privately rather than on the forum. I agree the best thing is not to fret over it, but it does pop into your mind at odd times. Kath
Posts.Title: Bone Scan

Posts.Content: It definitely depends on how effected you r by the chemo, and on your job. I work with adults with profound and multiple learning disabilities, and was told by the doctors that not only was the risk of infection too high, but that as the work can be very physical I should take sick leave. I have been glad I did. Kath
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and work

Posts.Content: All my kids did selfies and donated, and my nephew started a new trend for guys to do selfies WITH makeup. I put a pic on but wasn't brave enough to take my hat off. I think it's great although there have been a few people knocking it ... I don't understand why!
Posts.Title: Selfies and donations

Posts.Content: I went for a spa weekend while having chemo, and the same happened to me. I was advised not to use the pool or the sauna or anything, and was only allowed certain treatments, and they had to be gentler than usual. I'm no sure why, but I think it has something to do with damaging the skin as it's much more delicate and heat is not good either as can make you dizzy. Not a complete answer but hope it helps. Kath. It was still brilliant and relaxing though. Well worth doing.
Posts.Title: Chemo and spa treatments

Posts.Content: When I was at my worst during chemo I felt just like you, that I couldn't go on, but somehow I found the strength. I knew I wanted every chance to be here for my grandchildren. Reading peoples stories on here helped, and the amazing support from the great ladies on here as well. You're half way through its downhill from now on, I know it's hard but it's worth it in the end. I hope everything works out for you. The best advice I was given was to listen to my body and stop and rest when needed, the more tired you get the harder it seems. Take it easy and accept any offers of help you get. Kath.
Posts.Title: chemotherapy - I'm struggling

Posts.Content: I found loads of really nice hats. I didn't want a wig, so now have a collection of different colours and styles of hats.
Posts.Title: ebay - bargains

Posts.Content: Great, I found myself reading it in Pam Ayres voice!
Posts.Title: I Wish I'd Felt Both Of Me Tits - (adapted from Pam Ayers)

Posts.Content: I had terrible issues eating as my tastes changed and I never felt hungry. I was already taking omeprazole to counteract the ibuprofen I take for hip pain but did find I got reflux occasionally. I found gaviscon helped but check its ok to take first. My taste is still weird months later and I've lost over 4 stone. I loathe anything sweet, so no cake for me. I really miss it but whenever I try it seems so sweet and leaves a horrid taste in my mouth. No sugar in my coffee now either. Kath
Posts.Title: Food changes

Posts.Content: I am due to start 18 weeks of chemo at the end of jan, and have a family holiday booked at a cottage in croyde at Easter. We've got two large cottages booked for us, my kids and their kids. I was about to pay the rest of the money, but my husband says he doesn't think we should go as I'll be too ill. I am having trouble after my op with seroma etc, and he says if I can't cope with this how will I cope with chemo. I was really looking forward to this and now feel so low. I was going to try and start my chemo so I'd be in the third week when we go. What does everyone think. I don't know what to do.
Posts.Title: Holidays during chemo.

Posts.Content: Well two five hour shifts in at work, and coping alright so far. Phased return so not too strenuous, but fingers crossed I'm going to b ok. It's good to be back but a bit scary, sooo much to catch up on!!!!
Posts.Title: Back to work.

Posts.Content: It's funny how differently chemo affects us isn't it, I had exactly the opposite reaction. I lost my appetite completely, everything tasted horrid, my mouth was sore and I had no energy to make food. I lost 2.5 stone. I still don't want sweet stuff or citrusy stuff, drinks except coffee and strangely tonic water r a no no. Water yech! It's five weeks since my last chemo and I'm still losing weight (not a bad thing for me as I am large ). Chocolate is also yech. It feels funny on my tongue. I miss treats though. I think the best thing is not to worry about your weight but eat whatever you can. I found I was extra tired because for a week after each dose of chemo I could eat nothing except occasionally marmite on toast, as soon as I could eat a bit more I felt better. Enjoy your sweets! Kath
Posts.Title: food

Posts.Content: I had a little in tax, but I had been told to ring up the department immediately if it happened, so I would think you should. My ties are still a bit numb 3 months later, I was taken off tax and put back on FEC. I had other reactions as we'll. I really think you should ring the chemo help line at your hospital. Kath
Posts.Title: numbness on chemo

Posts.Content: I had 3 of my nodes were affected, but I only had a scan for my bone density before I started my tablets. I don't think they scan for secondaries unless there is a reason to be suspicious. I finished my treatment about four months ago and it is scary not having any more input. Kath
Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Content: My throat got sore with every chemo I had. Wasn't infection, not sure what caused it but it happened with FEC and tax. Kath
Posts.Title: docetaxel effects

Posts.Content: If that doesn't help, nystatin is good, or there are tablets, but need to get them from your GP.
Posts.Title: Do i need antibiotics

Posts.Content: My smile today was looking at the new clothes my daughter dragged me out to buy last weekend. She told me everything I had was too big for me as I've lost so much weight.
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: I'm on anastrozole, I find I get tired, awful hot flushes, can't sleep and no appetite. Some days are worse than others, but I do think I'm gradually adapting to them
Posts.Title: Anastrasole/Arimidex Questions (for invasive lobular breast cancer...

Posts.Content: Hi, I wonder if it's possible your mum didn't realise the call was for you. Maybe she just though it was an error and didn't connect it to you, and if she was a bit suspicious when you didn't say anything that might have confirmed it for her. It's not always easy being a mum to know when to ask questions and when to wait to be talked to. I've got two daughters and sometimes one will tell me something I don't know about the other and I have to wait until they tell me themselves Maybe you should tell your mum how you feel she'll probably be gutted you are feeling like that. Kath
Posts.Title: I'm so disappointed in my mum, I feel so lonely.

Posts.Content: I know this is minor really, but as I get more over the surgery and into the chemo I find it's bugging me. I had two lumps removed eventually, and am now very lopsided. I have large breasts. I'm a 24 at the top and 18 at the bottom. My right breast is now two sizes bigger than my left. I don't want more surgery, but surely there is something I can get to put in my bra to balance things up. Any ideas? Kath
Posts.Title: Bras for lopsided boobs

Posts.Content: I know what you mean, it does feel strange. I've gone back to work which has helped me feel ore normal, even though I'm only working my way back slowly. These feelings will ease. K
Posts.Title: All my treatment nearly finished, weird feeling.

Posts.Content: I haven't started my radiotherapy yet, but have been warned only to use Simple products while having it. No deodorant or perfume. I should get in touch with your breast care nurse. Kath.
Posts.Title: RT and skin rashes

Posts.Content: Is there a length of time we have to wait before colouring hair? Mine was already quite white but seems to be coming back pure white and although growing doesn't show at all. Kath
Posts.Title: Advice on dying hair 1st time after chemo

Posts.Content: And I'd be interested to know what anastrozole does then as that's what they gave me as I'm post menopausal. Have to look them up in the BNF at work and see what Information is there. Kath
Posts.Title: Letrozole and oestrogens in food

Posts.Content: Hi all you lovely people. Feeling really good today, bit tired and rather red in patches but hey I've finished all my treatment. Just had my last radiotherapy (no more driving to Poole and back ). All good at six month check up as well. Just anastrozole and adcal D3 now. I'm planning to go back to work for a few hours next week and I can't wait. My manager and the company have been amazing and have carried over my leave from last year so I have 63 days to use up so I can get full pay and still make a phased return. They've also said if full time proves too much ( I am 61 after all) I could cut my hours down which as I'm the deputy manager is good of them. I have had so much support throughout all this I feel very lucky in that way. Family friends and colleagues have been great, and having here to unburden myself when needed has been wonderfull. Thanks for listening and remember there is light at the end of the tunnel. Kath
Posts.Title: I did it!!!

Posts.Content: I've been a bit slow. Jut figured out why my GP was so concerned I see someone t the hospital quickly. The symptoms I've got which I thought was cellulitis are the symptoms of inflammatory breast cancer they match exactly. I see someone on Thursday. Is it possible to get this after lobular cancer?
Posts.Title: Awake and scared

Posts.Content: Hi. I'm dreading tomorrow. I've just looked at my breast and it's bright red and three lots of antibiotics have done nothing. All of which makes me more worried. I can't sleep. Sorry to moan but I'm getting more and more scared. I'm not googling but it's tempting. Still at least my hubby's review today was ok. So one good thing. Thanks for your reply mistymoly. Kath.
Posts.Title: Awake and scared

Posts.Content: I had awful headaches with my first two chemos, but the oncologist thought it could be the steroids and lowered my dose which seemed to help. I also had nosebleeds, and was told it was the chemo. As it stopped after my final chemo I guess that was it. Kath
Posts.Title: sore head and bleeding nose

Posts.Content: Hi Jill, Just wanted to let you know that although your group is private to become a member anyone who looks at your profile can look at the posts in the group. Only members can post but anyone can look at it. Kath
Posts.Title: Support group on Facebook

Posts.Content: Be careful if you get bio oil, make sure it's from a reputable supplier as there are a lot of rip offs of it out there.
Posts.Title: dry peeling sore skin

Posts.Content: I love my ipad. When I'm stuck in bed like I am today cos I ache all over after my first T it's a godsend. I can watch TV, chat to my children on Facebook, chat on here. And I admit it, play candy crush.
Posts.Title: Weird & Wobbly

Posts.Content: I was given a mouthwash called difflam which numbs the gums as well as being an antibacterial. It worked for me. Kath
Posts.Title: INFLAMMED GUMS

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm making the assumption that after 5 years people don't use this site any more!! However my aunt by marriage had breast cancer with some node involvement and went on to live another 25 years. A friend of mine is also going strong many years later. Hope this gives you some positive help. Kath.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer remission and 5 year plus survivors

Posts.Content: I was only told I must not change my grandsons nappy, and that I should avoid close contact with them if they had a bug. Unless your friends grandchild is ill I don't think there should be a problem. If your worried check with your oncology nurses. I'm sure they would know. K
Posts.Title: risk of infection- chemo

Posts.Content: Off to Bournemouth this morning with my lovely sister in law, she's got a lump in her breast now. She's been so supportive while we have been going through it all, I am praying it's not cancer. What with Jessie's op coming up, and now this we seem to go from hospital to hospital. I'm reaching the end of my tether. It seems as if nothing good is left. Oh well fight on I suppose. Kath
Posts.Title: It never lets up.

Posts.Content: Hi. Sounds nasty. I start radiotherapy on 23rd June, was already nervous as I have red hair, well had when I was younger, got to be honest it's nearly white now, pure white when it grows back I think. However red heads have very sensitive skin, I burn if I look at the sun. Anyone got any tips for protecting the skin. Hope everyone else's improves soon. Kath
Posts.Title: Blisters after Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi. Sounds nasty. I start radiotherapy on 23rd June, was already nervous as I have red hair, well had when I was younger, got to be honest it's nearly white now, pure white when it grows back I think. However red heads have very sensitive skin, I burn if I look at the sun. Anyone got any tips for protecting the skin. Hope everyone else's improves soon. Kath
Posts.Title: Blisters after Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Why not get gloves? That's what I was told to do when doing any cleaning even down to washing up. Kath
Posts.Title: ph levels in cleaning products

Posts.Content: Actually your work should really supply them for you, as you now come under the disability act and need them to get back to work. K
Posts.Title: ph levels in cleaning products

Posts.Content: I'm taking anastrozole and I started it 4 weeks after my chemo but before my radiotherapy started. I guess everyone gets different advice. My radiotherapy was five weeks after my chemo. Kath
Posts.Title: after chemo

Posts.Content: Good luck Paul. Wishing you the best. Kath
Posts.Title: thank yuo to evertone

Posts.Content: MDT. If this refers to the multi disciplinary team which is the only medical reference I know of, it is quite normal procedure for all sorts of issues. It ensures that your treatment, appointments, results etc are seen by everyone who might need to have input in your case. You might benefit from chatting to one of the nurses on this site, as they are very helpful, or talk to your GP who will be able to explain what is said in the letter. Hope this helps a bit, it's hard I know to get your head around everything. Good luck. Kath
Posts.Title: Total duct excision

Posts.Content: I don't want to be negative, it's your choice after all, but I do want to advise you not to take the ultrasound of the lymph nodes as definite. Mine were clear according to ultrasound, but when they operated they found three affected ones. Just something to bear in mind, ultrasound isn't always accurate. Kath.
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: The worst comment I heard was not to me but a man talking to his wife who said " breast cancer these days is no worse than a boil on the bum, I don't know why they make such a fuss about it." This was in a hospital waiting room when I was waiting for yet more test results an wasn't in the mood to respond.
Posts.Title: Another "dumb things people say" video

Posts.Content: Hi Emma. So sorry to hear your news, I know how you feel. I've had hip pain for years, but it's got worse while I've been on chemo, but could be the injections. My oncologist wants me to have a bone scan after the chemo has finished, and of course I am now petrified all over again. I do hope things improve for you, and I will be thinking of you. Kath
Posts.Title: It's Back! And this time it's...

Posts.Content: I found the same, I really worried about my hair loss, but everyone has been so supportive, it was nowhere near as bad as I expected. I think the only person who hasn't got used to it is me, I still get a shock when I look in a mirror. It's growing a little now I've had my last chemo and I'm looking forward to having it back. One of the things that really made my laugh was my young granddaughter who told me my hair looked beautiful. When I said I don't really have any now do I she said well your head looks beautiful.
Posts.Title: Hair worries

Posts.Content: Just had a look at the site, but they don't do any large cap size wigs. I'm having that problem wherever I try. Kath
Posts.Title: Wig Photo (attempt)

Posts.Content: If the pads they have given you do not work, it might be worth getting her assessed by an incontinence nurse for better ones, and you can get disposable incontinence sheets which go on top of the sheets and might protect the bedding. This can be done through the GP. Xx
Posts.Title: Chronic diahorea

Posts.Content: If you keep on having indigestion, omeprazole on prescription works really well.
Posts.Title: Strange sensation

Posts.Content: Hi, sounds like your in almost exactly my situation, only a few months behind. It's horrid when everything seems to get worse at each appointment isn't it? I'm on my 5th lot of chemo now and I won't say it's easy. My second op was on Christmas Eve, they actually had to remove an affected lymph node from my breast as well, right next to the initial lump, I had three others affected in my armpit as well. I didn't go with the cold cap either as I heard it could cause headaches and I get migraines anyway. I didn't get a wig but lots of hats and have not found hair loss as much of an issue as I thought I would. It's growing back slowly now, and I quite like my bit of white fuzz. I don't think anyone deserves cancer but the important thing is it is treatable. Take it a day at a time, rest when you need to, and accept any help that is offered. I hope it all goes as well as it can for you, and don't be afraid to moan on here on your bad days. Kath
Posts.Title: Advice - any much appreciated

Posts.Content: Hi Lesley, that sounds horrid. I'm not feeling or being sick, just not hungry. And food still tastes horrid. I hope you get your endoscopy soon and that nothing's going on. Kath.
Posts.Title: Weight loss continues after treatment well finished.

Posts.Content: Hi all. I just wondered if anyone else has continued to lose weight after all their treatment was finished. My treatment ended about four months ago and I've still got no appetite to speak of and everything tastes bad. I'm back at work and get very tired and don't feel like cooking much either. My husband doesn't need me to cook for him so no real incentive. I've now lost 4 stone, but am still slowly losing more. I know anastrozole can cause lack of appetite as well so could be that as well. Do your taste buds ever get over the shock as I really miss chocolate etc. can't eat anything sweet. Can't have any sweet drinks. I am not sorry to have lost weight but I'm not trying to and it's still continuing. Kath
Posts.Title: Weight loss continues after treatment well finished.

Posts.Content: I'm on my first session of FEC. Given injections of lenograstim to boost white blood count for fourth day for seven days.. No one said to put in fridge so read this and panicked. However box doesn't say to go in fridge, only below 30c. Phew. I'm doing myself at least I plan to. Mine has to be mixed before use, maybe that's why it doesn't need to go in the fridge, it's a vial of powder and a syringe of water with two needles for the syringe. Kath.
Posts.Title: Self injections for 7 days

Posts.Content: Thanks dreamthief. I'm on the app on my phone. Guess I need to go to the full site as not got that as far as I can see. Ok at the mo as pennyfarthing is going to have them. Got to go to full site for friends as well. Kath. Xx
Posts.Title: Headwear free to a good home.

Posts.Content: Hi, I have some turban style hats and a couple of sleep or round the house type headgear and a couple if other bits that I will happily send to anyone who might have a use for them. They r quite nice and smart. I will give them a wash before I send them. Please let me know if you would like them. Kath. Free of course. Xx I'll put some pictures on if someone can tell me how.
Posts.Title: Headwear free to a good home.

Posts.Content: Hi pennyfarthing, can you let me know if you've sent me your address cos then I'll go to the main computer. Xx
Posts.Title: Headwear free to a good home.

Posts.Content: I'm guessing your kath and your OH is Norman, snap. Surnames not Harper by any chance, now that would be odd!
Posts.Title: mobile phone and breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello Valusha, You have come to the right place for help, although I fear none of us will know much about treatment in the Ukraine, It must be hard for both of you. Please ask questions and I'm sure everyone here will do their best to answer them for you. Kath
Posts.Title: Hello, please help my dougter!

Posts.Content: Hi. Have accepted you as friend, and left you a message. Kath.
Posts.Title: Headwear free to a good home.

Posts.Content: I have a recollection of reading something about suspicions of keeping your phone in your bra being a risk a while ago, and warning my daughters and especially my daughter in law not to do this. So there may be something in this, but I don't remember what research had been done. However there are so many things that can cause or increase the risk of cancer that it's nearly impossible to avoid them all.
Posts.Title: mobile phone and breast cancer

Posts.Content: I think the chemo affects everyone in different ways, so you have to wait and see how it goes. I am a nurse for adults with learning disabilities and there is no way I could work, but I know of others who have managed all the way through to at least do some hours. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Startin cHemo next week

Posts.Content: It all depends on your job, and what other treatment your having, I was off from my op in December until now as had chemo and was told not to work during it as my job would have high risk of infection even if I'd felt up to it. Also had radiotherapy and as it was an hour each way plus anything from 1 to 3 hours at the hospital it just wasn't feasible. Luckily I work for a great company so am now back on a phased return. It really does vary as some people work and others don't. K.
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: I was in the waiting room before seeing the oncologist when a man who was waiting for the results of a blood test for iron levels was talking to his wife. He announced that breast cancer wasn't an issue any more, no worse than a boil on the bum! And he didn't know why women made such a fuss about it. I'd swap any day.
Posts.Title: Most outrageous, ridiculous etc

Posts.Content: I had my lymph nodes stripped and a second small lump removed on Christmas Eve. Found out today that all these lymph nodes were clear. I feel a lot happier now. I know I've chemo and radiotherapy to come and I'm not looking forward to it, but I feel a lot more positive now. They also drained half a litre of fluid from my underarm, I had to nag to get them to do it, but it does feel better. So a good day for a change. It's been a long nine months as my husband had cancer of the oesophagus as well, he is still really unwell but the cancer is gone. He is tube fed and needs to learn to eat again. Kath
Posts.Title: Phew.

Posts.Content: I have redness over the whole of my breast, and it is painful. I saw my GP again today and am on a third week of antibiotics. I should try your GP as they can check it for you.
Posts.Title: Bruising after lymph node removal

Posts.Content: I was told that as you only have the steroids for a few days they shouldn't affect weight at all but can stop you sleeping. I had my dose reduced as gave me migraines. You have to have them before T to reduce chance of a bad reaction, otherwise mainly anti sickness. Kath
Posts.Title: steroids?

Posts.Content: You should never feel guilty about moaning, what we are going through is horrible, and if you can't moan to us who can you moan to. There have been days when putting how I feel on here is all that's kept me going. Good luck and loads of cyber hugs. Kath
Posts.Title: Another Biopsy really scared

Posts.Content: I agree with Kate, contact your nurse, but I don't think you need to worry too much, after my first wle I had both a bit of blood quite a while after and a small hole developed which poured out fluid. Neither were a problem. Except to be embarrassing when I was out one day and lost a lot of fluid which I suddenly noticed dripping down my shirt from my boob to my waist. I looked like I was breast feeding and overflowing. Lol. Kath.
Posts.Title: Tiny bleed from wound 2 weeks after surgery

Posts.Content: It's also worth trying eBay. That's where I got most of mine. There r some really pretty and quite dressy turbans. Good prices. Just type in chemo hat in the search. Kath
Posts.Title: hats and scarves ?
